channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The 'Trump Trade' Isn't What You Think
item.description: Some investments tied to a Trump win clearly worked, but with questionable logic. Others worked but at least in part for the wrong reasons. Some faile...

item.title: Amazon shares jump 6% after earnings beat
item.description: Amazon's latest upbeat results were driven by growth in cloud and digital advertising.

item.title: Amazon shares pop on earnings beat, cloud growth
item.description: The company's cloud and advertising units showed strong growth.

item.title: Why $11 Trillion in Assets Isn't Enough for BlackRock's Larry Fink
item.description: Fink wants to push the world’s largest asset manager into the more lucrative world of private markets.

item.title: Gold Edges Lower Ahead of U.S. Election, Fed Decision
item.description: Gold edged lower in early European trade as investors exercised caution ahead of the U.S. election and the Fed’s monetary policy decision.

item.title: OPEC+ Output Hike Delay Signals Price Concerns
item.description: Crude futures were more than 2% higher in Europe but DNB Markets said OPEC+’s decision to further delay its planned production increase indicates the ...

item.title: Exxon beats earnings estimates, increases fourth-quarter dividend
item.description: Exxon's stock rose in early trading after beating earnings expectations.

item.title: Chevron beats earnings expectations, returns more than $7 billion to shareholders
item.description: Chevron's stock is largely flat for the year, underperforming the S&P 500 energy sector which has gained more than 6%.

item.title: Stock Futures Up as Bonds Rally and Dollar, Oil Prices Weaken
item.description: Futures tied to the S&P 500, Nasdaq-100 and the Dow industrials edged higher.

item.title: Coterra Energy posted a mixed quarter, but delivered beats where it matters most
item.description: Once again, management's strict adherence to cost discipline meant strong earnings and free cash flow generation.
